original_title: Audio Synthesizer Hooked Up With ChatGPT Interface
original_content:
ChatGPT is being asked to handle all kinds of weird tasks, from determining whether written text was created by an AI, to answering homework questions, and much more. Its good at some of these tasks, and absolutely incapable of others. [Filipe dos Santos Branco] and [Edward Gu] had an out of the box idea, though. What if ChatGPT could do something musical?
They built a system that, at the press of a button, would query ChatGPT for a 10-note melody in a given musical key. Once the note sequence is generated by the large language model, its played out by a PWM-based synthesizer running on a Raspberry Pi Pico.
Ultimately, ChatGPT is no musical genius. Its simply picking a bunch of notes from a list that are known to work together melodically; thats the whole point of musical keys. It would have been wild if it generated some riffs on the level of Stairway to Heaven or Spontaneous Devotion, but that might be asking for too much.
Heres the question, though. If you trained a large language model, but got it to digest sheet music instead of written texts could it learn to write music in various genres and styles? If someone isnt working on that already, theres surely an entire PhD you could get out of that idea alone. We should talk!
In any case, its one of the more creative projects from the ever-popular ECE 4760 class at Cornell. Weve featured a bunch of projects from the class over the years, and noted how the course now runs on the RP2040.
title: ChatGPTがミュージカルなメロディを生成するシステムを作成！
body: ChatGPTは、AIによって作成されたテキストを判断したり、宿題の質問に答えたりするなど、さまざまな奇妙なタスクをこなしています。音楽の作成もできるというアイデアから、Raspberry Pi Pico上で動作するPWMベースのシンセサイザーが開発されました。ただし、ChatGPTは音楽の天才ではありません。楽曲は既知の音符から選ばれて生成されます。シートミュージックを学習させることで、様々なジャンルやスタイルの音楽を作成することができるかもしれません。
